meanings.definition: To break or shatter into pieces.
meanings.sent1: The vase smashed into many tiny fragments.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally smashed the window with a baseball.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy robot smashed the dishes while trying to wash them.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like it had been smashed into a million pieces.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake smashed the buildings, leaving rubble everywhere.

meanings.sent1: The hammer smashed the nail into the wood.
meanings.sent2: The boxer smashed his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy smashed into the door while chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The storm smashed against the shore, causing huge waves.
meanings.sent5: The car smashed into the wall, creating a loud noise.

meanings.sent1: After the party, they all smashed many drinks.
meanings.sent2: He smashed too many beers and felt sick the next day.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends decided to smash shots to celebrate.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had smashed a whole bottle of wine by herself.
meanings.sent5: The bar was full of people smashing cocktails and having a good time.
